Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O, children, since I have completed this book for you, which is the last of the science of medicine, through its completion and for its explanations and declarations, it seems to me that I should complete that part of the operation with your hands, which is surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	Because the operation with hands is neglected in our region and in our time, to such an extent that it endangers the science of medicine itself, and its vestiges are suppressed; there remain only a few brief descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which have been distorted and lead those who follow them into error and hesitation, while their minds are closed off and the strength and art of surgery is stretched out.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	It seems to me that I should revive it by the arrangement of this treatise in accordance with the method of exposition and explanation and abridgment; and also for the forms of cautery irons and other instruments of operation as well as for their use, through the addition of explanation, and preparation, which is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	The reason why a good artisan is not found with his hand in these our times is because the art of medicine is long, and its practitioner must first be exercised in the science of anatomy which considers the joints of the limbs and their forms, and the connection and disconnection of those; and have knowledge of the bones, nerves, and sinews, as well as their number and course; and of the pulsing and quiet veins, and the places for their exit.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And Hippocrates says that it has a great name, but little effect in practice, and especially in the art of medicine.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	We have already mentioned this in the introduction of this book; for one who is ignorant of what we have said about anatomy cannot be excused if he falls into error and thereby causes the death of a man, as I myself have seen happen to many such individuals, because some are educated in this science but neglect their knowledge and practice.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	I saw a foolish and inexperienced doctor make an incision into a scrofulous abscess on the neck of a woman, and he cut some arteries in the neck, causing so much blood to flow that the woman died between her sheets.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	I saw another doctor who was about to remove a stone from a man's bladder, which had caused him great pain; and he brought it out by cutting open the bladder, but this led to the man's death three days later.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	I have already been called upon to remove such a stone and saw that due to the size of the stone and the condition of the patient, I knew he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	Here is the translation of the given text:
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called upon by them, and prepared to loosen the ligature, and indeed it resulted in calmness and this way his pains subsided.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	However, if decay has already firmly established itself in the limb so that it cannot be checked, and there ceases to be any hope of saving the patient.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another doctor who pierced an abscess with a cancerous sore that had been ulcerated for some days and the seriousness of which he belittled before his patient.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The reason for this is that the root of the ulceration was formed in the black bile, and therefore it should not be treated with iron tools but rather only at the site where the suffering occurs.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And therefore, my children, it is necessary for you to divide the operation into two parts; one part that involves an operation associated with health and another part involving work where there are greater dangers.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already mentioned this in every part of this book where the operation is a mistake and to be feared; because it is necessary for you to beware of this and leave that one alone so as not to let loose talk shame you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore, take up your weapons with solicitude and under the protection of God; treat your patients with ease and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	Use the best path, by the grace of God, leading to salvation and praiseworthy success; leave behind those terrible diseases that are difficult to cure, and put aside your weapons, which cause you fear, so that doubt does not evade your faith and your name: for greater remains in your glory, both here on earth and beyond among your sanctities.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Wisdom has already spoken through some of its teachings:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat bad diseases, lest you be called bad doctors.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	The division of the book begins, and first in the first part:
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter is ordered, which deals with the feet, regarding the types of instruments and the tools for cauterization, as well as what is necessary for the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, regarding drying and piercing methods, cupping, plasters, and the extraction of arrows or similar objects, all thoroughly outlined with instructions on the use of various instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter covers restoration and dislocation, as well as the treatment of twists and similar injuries; this chapter is specifically focused on the head and feet, detailing the methods and instruments required.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Regarding the use of hot and sharp cauterization as well as the application of acute medicinal remedies, with reminders on performing operations.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With this, we begin the treatise for the entire book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	I wish to discuss the quality of the iron used for this cautery and the documentation required for it, as well as in which cases cauterization is prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore, I say that the discourse on the quality of cautery iron and its documentation is lengthy and verbose, subtle in its science, and hidden in secrecy; many wise men have spoken greatly about it, but they disagree, and so a small portion of their discourses suffices for me, fearing prolonging this.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text into English: 
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And he said that those who say the opposite of this claim that there is benefit in cautery for all dry and cold illnesses that affect men's bodies because when you compare man's body and its moistness to fire, you find man's body cold.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say this based on the words of the former that I already experienced this several times and it was revealed to me.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, it is not necessary for me to explain this matter further since the former has already been thoroughly explored and practiced in the chapter on cautery through previous experience; he understands the diversity of men's constitutions and the disposition of illnesses within their bodies, along with their causes, symptoms, and duration.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But for other constitutions, you should have no fear; especially in the case of cold and moist illnesses where all doctors are in agreement on these matters and do not disagree about the use of cautery as a beneficial treatment.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, my sons, that the secret of cure by cautery with fire and its goodness is found in cautery with caustic medicine, for fire is simple; its action only affects the part being cauterized without harming other nearby parts except to a small degree.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	Moreover, the action of caustic medicine when applied to those parts that are far from the affected member can easily bring disease with a difficult cure and quickly spreads it.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But fire, due to its excellence and the goodness of its substance, only produces superfluidity in us. And it is known to us through experimentation and a long period of study into the art that deals with the truth of causes; hence I am excused for the length of my speech. If it were not because my book is not read by this rustic person, who hides from you the secret of fire and its quality within bodies, as well as the operation through which diseases are expelled, in a philosophical demonstration speech that would have sharpened your minds.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And you know, my sons, that they disagree about the time in which it is appropriate to do cautery and consider spring to be the best time.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	I say that cautery is appropriate at all times because the harm caused by a delay due to an accident can be submerged in the benefit obtained from what is drawn out through cauterization; and this is especially true for pains or necessary evils, tumors, and fistulas, which cannot bear any delay as it could lead to greater harm arising from minor initial damage due to such delays.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	Moreover, superfluous cauterization is employed in medicine due to the speed of its effect, the strength of its virtue, and the importance of the lord's authority.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	It is possible that the illness may return at some point in time, depending on the patient's constitution, the location of their ailment, their inherent strength, and the extent to which superfluities have accumulated within them due to internal causes or external intake through food and similar sources; unless the ailment treated with cauterization is a subtle one affecting a limb that has few excesses and humors, like toothaches and similar pains, it is possible for such pain not to return in the patient - this can be achieved by doing [cauterization] gently.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	The common saying goes that cauterization is the final resort in medicine, and this is a correct statement - not because of what it entails but due to people's understanding of it; they believe that it does not constitute proper healing or benefit from medicine or any other means except cauterization.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	The reason is the opposite of what was just stated; and the intended meaning behind calling cauterization a final resort in medicine is not as people commonly believe it to be but rather when we apply various methods of healing to certain ailments without success, and thus finally administer cauterization at the end of this process - benefiting from it.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And then from here you must understand that the cautery is the last resort of medicine, not according to the intention of what common people and too many foolish doctors think.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	The ancients said that a cautery made of gold is better than one made of iron, and they said this only because of the purity and excellence of gold.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the place of cauterization does not cause harm, but this is not absolutely true, for I have proven it and found that it only causes such an effect in certain bodies, not others; thus a cautery made with gold is good and better than iron, as they claimed. However, when you use a golden cautery heated by fire, be aware of its limitations because the amount of heat produced depends on the quantity of gold you have according to its purity; the gold must be prepared in such a way that it can receive this heat, and if it is not done properly the gold will melt due to the fire's intensity. In case some of these sheets should become damaged during this process, the craftsman can provide new ones for use.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And so it is for this reason that iron cauteries are made as light as possible, and in the most precise manner to ensure accurate operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have already arranged this chapter about cauterization according to different chapters, and I have organized those related to the head down to the feet, so that later the reader can easily find what he is looking for.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	On the cauterization of head pain caused by coldness and moisture.
Le capitol primier.	Chapter one.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization is applied to the moist and cold accident of the brain, which has two causes: one is a sore and numerous traumatic fluxes called coryza, from the head down to the temples and ears running, along with great sleepiness, toothaches, as well as throat pain. It also applies universally to any illness caused by coldness, such as paralysis, apoplexy, and similar diseases.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cauterization is as follows: first, command the patient to be evacuated with a laxative medicine that cleanses the head; this should be done for three or four nights, depending on the nature and health of the patient, their age, and usual habits.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	Then command the patient to shave their head, and make them sit between your two hands on a chair with arms, placing their hands on their own legs.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	Then place your fingertips, along with the creases of your palm, right above his nose between his nostrils.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, when your finger has reached the affected area inside me, mark that spot by trying out this olive-shaped cauterization tool which comes in the following form:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	Then place it on the marked spot and handle it in such a way that your hand gradually compresses it until you rotate it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	Then lift your hand slightly and examine the area; if you see that some part of the bone or a quantity of gravel has been exposed, raise your hand and return to the same tool or another one like it but cooled down until you notice what I have instructed you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	Then take a little bit of salt, dissolve it on the area, and leave it there for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	Afterwards, place on him some cold leech and let it sit there until the burn scar is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	Then cure the area with ointment made of four medications until it heals.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And they will say that when the plague remains open, the arm is better healed, for it is more beneficial and healing.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And some say that the vein should be cauterized near the bone, and [the cauterization tool] should be held in place until a part of the outer layer of the bone becomes adhered.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	Then remove what has stuck to the bone, and it shall be healed.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And others say that you should bring the cautery to the back [side] until it strongly presses against the bone such that the bone sinks inwards. This is called 'small alpecatti':
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	They believe that vapours from the head emanate from this place.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And if the wound remains open for a long time, it shall be healed as it becomes consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	I have not seen these two types of cauterization in practice myself but only heard about them through word-of-mouth; however, I believe that it is better for health when the head becomes debilitated due to a loss of continuity as we mentioned before with other parts of the body and especially so if the patient's head is naturally cold.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first type of cautery is safer and more beneficial for me, and from that practice and with that work comes salvation.
Capitol segon.	Chapter Two.
Del cauteri del cap.	Regarding the cauterization of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When there is persistent and prolonged pain throughout the entire head of a patient, after having tried various treatments such as warblers, cockroaches, leeches, plasters, poultices, sponges, hen's combs, and similar remedies, but with no improvement or benefit from any of these causes, consider this: if the head of the patient is formed in a strong constitution by nature; and it does not feel cold nor shows great pallor, then cauterize it again with another cautery device, slightly milder than the previous one.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	Then cauterize that area above their temple with a split-ring cautery.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Incise the ring and expose the bone to the extent we have mentioned earlier, then cauterize it with a cautery on the back part of the head in the place called 'vas' - which is where the cupping glass is placed.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I will place this cautery in its correct position, for the cautery with which you cauterize the horns of the head and the occiput is a more delicate cautery than that with which you cauterize the middle part of the head; and this is its shape.
Capitol ters.	Chapter three.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	On the cauterization of non-ancient hemorrhoids.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When a hard pain arises from the back of the head or spreads inside to the eye, evacuate it with medicines that purify the head and administer other treatments I have mentioned for different illnesses; if none of these are beneficial, then cauterization can be done in two ways: either with an acrid medicine that burns out [the bad humors], or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	A better method of cauterization with medicine is to take a fig leaf and scrape it, then fold the two ends together.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	Then make an incision in the painful spot on the temple with a lancet so that it is at the same level as the hairline but hidden by it.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	And then press firmly on him with a bandage for a short time, and leave him like that for three hours; and then untie him and move him to another place, and leave the wound for two or three days, and then apply to it a poultice made of barley water until the area becomes warm.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then treat him with ointment so that he may be healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, make these with some caustic medicines which I have written about in the second treatise on caustic medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	May the cauterization be done with iron, according to this manner: take a cautery of which this is the form:" (presumably followed by an illustration or description of the shape).
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	It is called 'claus clavilhs', because its head has the form of a nail with some curvature, and in the middle of it there is a small raised area." (This description could be referring to a specific type of cautery tool used in medieval medicine).
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	And then place it on the area of pain, and keep your hand still - so that you do not move the bowstring which is underneath - and rotate the iron tool slowly with speed." (Here, 'bowstring' likely refers to a string-like structure in the body, such as a nerve or tendon).
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	Here is the translation of your first source sentence: 
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Certainly! Here is my translation of the first source sentence: 
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you want to cauterize the tip of the little finger with a pointed cautery tool, be careful not to cut into the artery in that slightly older vein.
Capitol quart.	Chapter Four.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	On the cauterization of an older vein.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat the older vein using what we have discussed for previous treatments and as mentioned in the sections on illnesses, and if the treatment is not effective due to a disease that does not respond to the first cauterization method with medicine or the hot iron cautery method, then it is necessary that you ignite the knife-like cautery until it becomes white-hot. This means applying it along the length of the painful area, either halfway up the finger or whatever [area] else; and place your hand over once to hold it there so as not to cut into the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to be careful not to damage the jawbone, which is essential for chewing and must not adhere to or harm the nerve that controls it, nor should it become spasmodic.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about the care and caution needed for the bleeding of an opened artery, as there is fear when opening it, especially among those who do not know what they are doing and are inexperienced or unprepared; and leave such operations to them at the start.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I will come back to the recollection of the regimen for the accidental flow of blood from archery according to its manner, in its place within this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see that this illness does not respond to the aforementioned cautery and you find the patient's body is tolerable, cauterize it in its central location on the head as we have recounted, and treat the wound until it has healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you, administer the cautery which we have mentioned in the chapter on archery wounds using two cauteries, this is the better and more effective method of cauterization.

De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	On the cauterization of earache.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When there is pain in the ear due to coldness and it is treated with laxative remedies and other treatments I have mentioned previously but the pain persists, then apply the cautery. This type of cautery is called 'punctate,' and its shape is as follows:" 
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	And then prick close to the fire, and it should be moved around the entire ear as if it were a wheel turning, or in the vicinity of each temple if the pain is on either side.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Run the cautery along the root of the ear gently until you feel the area with your touch.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the ten points of the whole ear are cauterized with hot iron, heal those places until they become healthy.
Capitol .vi.	The number 'vi' likely refers to chapter 6. Is there any text from this chapter you would like me to translate?
De cauterizacio de turtura.	On the cauterization of torture." 
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat this type of torture with herbs, enemas, and washes, but your treatment does not work, then it is necessary to cauterize the patient with three cauteries: one on the root of their ear, another just below their temple, and the third on the juncture of two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	Place your cautery on the opposite side of the affected area, as softening or improvement only occurs in the part that appears healthy.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	The method of cauterization is as follows: use the cautery on the right side of the top of the ear and another above the horn of the head, and for the temple area, make it the length of your little finger, and keep your hand with the cautery over the spot until half a link's width has been burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	This is the shape of the cautery, which is similar to that of a knife, with its tip being flat.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	However, it is better if this one has a few veins; you should cut away some of the superfluous thickness from it.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	Then treat the area with what has been previously processed until it is healed.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	Regarding the cauterization of ancient stroke victims.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When an ancient stroke is old and you treat it with what we have said and your medicine does not work, and the patient has no fever, then cauterize them with four cauteries: on all four corners of their head; and with a cautery in the middle of the scalp, as I have said; and another one at the nape.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the way of using the cautery is done as previously described.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And they have already been cauterized over the stomach opening, that is, the mouth of the stomach, and this is done after; then treat them with what proceeds.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	Regarding the cauterization of oblivion caused by flame.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	At the beginning, give the patient large cups of wine and purging pills that change their brain.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	Then shave the patient's entire head and place on their nape a plaster as described in the treatise of plasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And place some compresses there, for this is a way of applying cautery.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	Do this according to the order in which I have instructed you already.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And if it cures him well, then you're done; otherwise, make three more cauterizations at the very back of his head, coming down from the uppermost part of the skull to the lowest part above the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	Place something as thick as your finger between each cautery mark; then treat the cauterization with something that has been proven effective.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	But if you suspect an infection and the patient can tolerate it, make the cauterization in their median position; if the danger of the infection is greater, then do so at both temples.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Then treat it with something that has been proven effective to prevent infection, and let the olive oil cauterization take place according to the form given before.
Capitol .ix.	It seems like we have reached the end of this translation exercise. Is there anything else I can help you with? Perhaps another text to translate, or a different task altogether?
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	On the cauterization of palsy and the softening of the entire body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	Here is my translation of the first source sentence:
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	Under these circumstances when the patient's heart is softened and they are extremely weak due to their illness, then burn that part with four cauteries on the vertebrae of the spine, and finally use a red-hot iron rod to cauterize the affected area while you raise your hand above them.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	Then cure him as he heals from this, and use the olive tree's juice (as an ointment) for cauterization.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	On the cauterization of epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	The person with epilepsy should not be cauterized if their condition is caused by phlegm (one of the four humors).
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	You must therefore alter the patient's brain from the start with herbs and another cure, which we have mentioned in the section on treating severe cases that do not respond well to medication.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	If the patient is a child who cannot take medicine, then give him mouthwashes and chewing medicines to alter his brain, for several days in a row, while also giving him nutritious food.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	Then scrape the patient's head and burn him with one cautery in the middle of his forehead as described previously, apply another to his occipital bone, and cauterize each corner of his head.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And apply the olive oil cauterization as previously described.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	When the patient is a child, use a gentle cauterization technique in the following manner.
Capitol .xi.	Here is my best guess at translating your text: 
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	De cauterizacio de melencolia." 
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholia are corrupted dampness and weakness in the body, then cauterize that area with the cauteries we mentioned for treating paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholia is an excess that leads to it and the patient's body is humid, then give them a drink that purifies their brain according to what was mentioned before in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	Then shave the patient's head and make a decently-sized pigeon from their hair over the circle; then place it in the middle of their head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And if the patient is 60 days old, let him be held in every part.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	Then apply the poultice, which is more worthy of being made from old sheep fat.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And heat it over the fire to warm it up gradually; this is what they call suffering when something hot is applied.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	Then place it in the middle of their head within the circle; leave it there until it cools down.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	Do this to the patient once every week until he is healed or you can cauterize that place with small points according to its size, but be careful not to touch it directly with your hand; this type of cautery moistens the brain equally.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And then place that swollen arm in bran or barley grains of hen.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	On the cauterization of the descending hydrocele.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you have identified the beginning of a hydrocele in the testicle through the signs I mentioned earlier, start by giving the patient something that dries their head and avoid all kinds of moisture.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And let him sit in warm water baths for some days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	Then have him shave his head and cauterize it with a cautery in the middle of the scalp; then cauterize with two cauteries over two temples if there is hydrocele beginning to form on both testicles, or just one side if it's only one testicle.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Cauterize with a red-hot iron all the veins and arteries that lie beneath the chain; let these cauteries be as long as the width of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	Be careful of the bleeding when you are cauterizing; and if you see that he is bleeding, stop it with any medicine that is available to you.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And I will come with wisdom which is in the extraction of arrows and in the removal of those and caution regarding blood flow.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And sometimes, it is cauterized in the neck, below the two bones with two hot irons that are directly applied.

De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	Concerning the cauterization of old wounds.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses. De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	Regarding the cauterization of nasal odor." 
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat the patient with what we have discussed in the previous section and their condition does not improve despite your medication, then you should prepare a drink for them made from cock's eggs to be consumed over three nights; then shave their head, and cauterize it with an olive-oil cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	Then, cauterize that area with a rosehip cautery using two cauteries placed over both eyebrows; leave the hair a little bit short.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful not to burn that area with the cautery.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	This is how the rosehip cautery should look like.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	On the use of softening cautery for eyelids.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid is softened due to illness or humidity, cauterize that eyelid with this lunar cautery; and this is its shape:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you want to cauterize that area over both eyebrows a little bit with two cauteries in total, and they should be elongated from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And let the length of each cautery be according to the quantity of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	Do not press the cautery too hard with your hand, but rather according to the amount that the third part of the eyelid is stuck together.
Capitol .xvi.	It seems you are providing me with a new text to translate. Please provide me with the full text, and I will translate it for you.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	On the cauterization of an infant's eyelid when their hair is divided into split ends.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the hair of an infant is divided into split ends in such a way that it affects them, there are two ways to cauterize: either with iron or with caustic medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If you are going to cauterize with fire, ask the infant to look at their hair like they would when having it cut, until their hairs are long and separated; if the split ends need to be removed, then you bind the child's hands with a bandage so that they cannot move while the hairs grow.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Once they are grown and separated, place the child's head in your lap, and then mark the infant's eyelid with a sign that is shaped like a myrtle leaf, starting from near the hairs.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And then place a poultice made of dried beans or crushed nettles on the wound.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	Then ignite the cautery, which is shaped like this.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	Cauterize according to the marked figure, little by little, in small visible spots, until the surface of the skin is burned like a myrtle leaf, appearing completely charred.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	A sign of the procedure's success is that you will see the eyelid of the wound contract and its hairs stand up above the puncture.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And so, lift your hand and leave it like that for three days, then apply a poultice with border until the scab forms.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then treat it with ointment until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	If the hairs grow back for any reason and the eyelid softens, then repeat the cauterization process on it just as you did initially.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the hairs are on the eyelid's underside, then cauterize it until it rises to its natural position and is even with them so that the hairs do not irritate the wound.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	Here is the translation of the sentence: 
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	Here is the translation of your first source sentence:
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And place your finger over the medicine and press it lightly without harming it until the patient feels a stinging sensation from the medicine, for this sting is like that of fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	So when you perceive that he feels this burning sensation, then remove the medicine and lift it away with your little finger; once the stinging stops, remove the medicine and wash the area with water. Then consider whether you should use a constriction method by using fire or incision, for if not done properly, return to the medicine on the spot where there was no pressure applied, and do not despair as your operation is saved and the eye will be cured.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	Then place a pad of cotton wool on it so that the infection is eradicated from the wound, and then treat it with an ointment made from deer's fat or another suitable substance until it heals.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary for you to guard your operation with diligent care that none of the medicine falls into the eye, and if after a few days the eyelid becomes softened and any hair causes pain in the eye, then repeat your medicinal application on this spot which has been softened, and do so just as at the beginning, and soon he will be healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is how you should place the leaves of myrtle.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And you should know that the veins of men are diverse according to their size and smallness, and thus your contraction is made accordingly.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And the way of healing shall not be hidden from him who has studied this art.

De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On the cauterization of a fistula that is in the tear duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula with what we have said in the divisions of diseases and your treatment does not take effect, then you should cauterize it in this way: command the patient to place their head on your lap, and have an assistant hold the patient's head between their hands so that they are not uncomfortable or agitated.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	Then place a cotton swab soaked in owl's albumen or bird's down on the patient's eye." Do you have any more text for me to translate?
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	Then ignite the cautery, which is of this shape:" It seems that you have omitted some information here; could you please provide me with the full text? This will allow for a more accurate translation.
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	The one that is concave, just like a cane or an eagle's feather shape, from its one extremity where it was made the cautery.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And you will enter with this from the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you wish to take it out, do so as gently as possible.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	However, the one that is concave is better for this procedure.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	Then compress the fistula if it's open, and try to clean and dry this.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it's not open, then you will have to cut it open and remove the pus.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	Then place on it the cautery which should be well ignited, and hold with your hand this little cautery stick close to the patient's nose, so you do not burn yourself or scare them, then place the cautery into the wound and destroy it.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And so if at the start of your cauterization process you pierce through the bone, well it is; and if not, then repeat the cautery once or twice as needed; leave it like that for three days, then place on it a gauze pad around this area with drying ointment until it heals.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if eleven days have passed and it is not healed, then apply an acute corrosive medicine on him until the bone is exposed and scrape according to what you find appropriate in his chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	Another way to cauterize a fistula, as some ancient authors said: go to the place of the fistula and open it; then put in that opening a soft thread whose form is appropriate for this operation. Put into that hole one ounce of melted lead; hold your hand with care so that the patient is not burnt by the molten lead that would get inside him; cover the wound on the patient's body with an egg white or some water, because lead solidifies the place of the fistula and heals it through a miraculous cure.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed by what we have said about cauterization and cure, it's good; but if not, then it is necessary to apply snuff through the nose in order to reduce the fistula towards the inside of the nose following what will appear in its proper place.

De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	Regarding the cauterization of a fistula in the mouth." 
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When there is an abscess in the uvula, palate, or between the teeth, and it becomes inflamed, ruptures, turns old (infected), drains pus, and forms a fistula which you treat but fails to heal, then it's necessary to use a cautery of size proportional to the amount received by the fistula. Place this ignited iron into the tract of the fistula; place your hand over his head so that the hot iron reaches its apex and base, doing this once or twice. Then cure him as we have said for healing.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	If the wound is incised and heals well, that's good. If not, it is necessary to uncover the area and expose the rotten bone as will be explained in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	On the cauterization of teeth and softening of veins.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the veins are softened due to moisture and the teeth are damaged, and you treat them with medicine but it doesn't work, then place the patient's head in your lap. Proceed by igniting a cautery of this shape: [describe the shape], and quickly place the cautery on top of the tooth, holding your hand lightly over it so that the patient feels the heat of the fire reach the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	Now lift your hand, and then repeat the cauterization a few times according to your will.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	Then have the patient fill their mouth with salt water and hold it there for an hour; afterward, dry it up, because a bad tooth is stopped and softened gums are tightened, and corrupt moisture is dried out.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Regarding the cauterization of toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When tooth pain is due to coldness, or the person is cold or weak, and you cannot treat it with medicine, then cauterization of that area can be done in two ways: either by using a cow's horn, or by applying heat.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cauterization using a horn involves taking the horn of a cow and boiling it in vinegar; then take a piece and wrap it around the end of an iron rod, then immerse that boiled horn with the rod into the horn, placing it on the painful tooth quickly before it cools.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then repeat this process several times until the heat of the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	Underwater the cotton or wool in the aforementioned liquid and place it on the aching tooth; then lay upon this an ignited iron until the heat reaches to the bottom of the hollow of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, when cauterizing with fire, be mindful of the metal rod or tube and ensure that there is no excess fat or moisture in the patient's mouth, as this could hinder the heat reaching them properly.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	Then shape the cautery to fit around the tooth and place it upon the tooth, holding your hand over it until the cautery has cooled; repeat this process a few times throughout that day or the next, as necessary for pain management.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	Ensure that, due to the pressure of the cautery, the patient fills their mouth with good quality liquid and holds this for an hour before spitting it out; this is how you should shape the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	Cauterize any extremity as best as you can.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	This refers to the previous text, which details how to shape the cautery for use in this procedure. It is not clear what 'cannula' refers to here. Could you provide more context or clarify your question? I can then better assist you with a translation if needed.
Capitol .xxii.	## Translation of the Text: 
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	De cauterizacio de extrophulos." 
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When ulcers are caused by phlegm and cold humors and do not respond to digestion through medicine, you will notice their light digestion; then you need the cautery in the form shown here, having two open ends that emit smoke from the cautery through the other end, placing it on the ulcer once, or more if needed until you reach the bottom of the ulcer.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the ulcer is small, then place the cautery according to its size; afterwards dress it for three days with ointment so that what has been burned by fire may heal.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	Then treat it with ointments, bandages, and linens until it is healed.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	The shape of the cannula or this type of cautery is as follows.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter 23.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	On the cauterization of hoarseness of voice and narrowness of windpipe.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When moisture affects the top of the lungs, and especially when it is accompanied by a cold constitution, then you must evacuate the patient at the start with laxative medicine; afterwards cauterize that place below the voice box.
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	And make sure you do not bring the cautery close to his neck or burn his collarbone, only slightly.
E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	Cauterize that area with another cautery, right at the junction of his neck and the lower back vertebra.
E·l cauteri de lu sia clavilh sego la maniera precedent.	Let his cautery be fixed securely, following the previous method.
E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	Then treat him with what has been prescribed earlier, until he is cured.

De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	On the cauterization of pulmonary diseases and coughing." 
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent. E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas.	And if you wish, let your cauterization be done with the pointed cautery, which is called 'puncta', and its shape should resemble that used in the cauterization of earache.
E sian puntz entro cays ad aquels; e aprop cura aquel am aquo meteys que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And if the cautery is applied to these areas, then treat it with something that has been proven effective beforehand for healing.
E ya sia le cauteri haventz tres ramps quar cauterizacio es am aquel: am una veguada podes far tres cauteris segon aquesta forma:	And since the cautery has three sides, you can use it for three types of cauterization with this method:
