Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquellas pessas, si so separadas.
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	If they are not separated, then let them lean on a pillow that is made moldy, as the removal of their legs will be alleviated.
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	And for other accidental wounds in the remaining parts of the body, the help provided during treatment is just what we have described above.
De las plaguas del ventre.	Of abdominal diseases.
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The discomfort that occurs in the abdomen is either great, little, or moderate.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	The great danger of severe abdominal pain is that the intestines or nerves become visible, requiring their re-insertion and a more complex suture.
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	A small abdominal rupture is also more difficult to manage because it has other complications and requires a more intricate reduction, without proper insertion into its place immediately upon opening it, as it swells up and becomes thicker, making the insertion process challenging.
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	Therefore, the best type of abdominal rupture is a moderate one since it does not present difficulties when reducing the intestines, unlike the other two types mentioned earlier.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	Remember that the suture of an abdominal wound can be performed in four different ways; however, only two are commonly used and similar to those used for other types of wounds on the body.
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	And two other specific stitches are used to communicate with the other wounds, but they are more appropriate and necessary for the suture of the abdomen.
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	And I recommend to you each one that an explanation and declaration be made.
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	So I say that when the wound is small and there is an apparent cause of the hernia due to it, and its reduction seems difficult, then this happens in one of two ways: either because of the small size of the rupture as we have said, or when the hernia has become inflamed due to the coldness of the air.
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	And so when this is the case, then it is necessary that you apply a cold compress to it by submerging a sponge or damp cloth in tepid water alone, or take some vinegar, cyperum (cypress?), spice, and introduce them into the hernia until the inflammation has been resolved.
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	And sometimes I have seen this done with astringent (styptic) materials, and it is better than water alone in resolving the inflammation.
E donc cum tu vezes la imflacio esser resolvuda, lahoras tu humecta le budel am aygua en la qual es coyta altea e malvas, quar per aquo es alleujat le intrament de lu am pauca causa.	And so when you see that the inflammation has been resolved, then moisten the hernia with water in which is soaked Althaea (marshmallow) and Malva (mallow), for by this its interior is soothed without causing pain.
Mays si es escusat le intrament de lu aprop aquesta curacio, lahoras scindeys la disrupcio un petit am strument am le qual so inscididas emorroydas.	Mays si es excusat l'intrament de lu aprop aquesta curacio, lahoras scindeys la disruptio un petit am strument am lo qual so incisiadas hemorroides.
E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.	And the primary cure is better when it is timely and appropriate, rather than having to resort to surgery, which should be avoided unless absolutely necessary.
Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	Regarding the instrument, consider its shape:
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc.	One part of it is sharp and angled, while the other part is not as acute; the tip is fine but not as delicate as a spatula, rather it is slightly blunt.
E donc cum la plagua es amplificada e yeys fora le budel, lahoras cove que la sua reduccio sia segon la forma de lu natural, en le sieu loc propri, si es possible sobre aquo, quar milhor es.	And when the wound is enlarged and the intestine has protruded, it must be ensured that its reduction (i.e., putting the intestine back in place) follows its natural form and position; if possible, this should be done carefully to avoid any harm.
Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos.	However, when the rupture is extensive and located in the lower abdomen, one must ensure that the patient lies on their back with their legs elevated higher than their head; if it's in the upper abdomen, the patient should be positioned with their head and feet raised above the affected area.
E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra.	Similarly, if the rupture is in one of the two sides of the abdomen, always pay attention and consider that the side with the wound should be positioned higher than the other to aid in healing.
E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	And so you should apply this treatment for large wounds and medium-sized wounds.
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	For small wounds, use the medicine you prepared and have it administered between your gloved hands, keeping the rupture completely in your hand and aligning its lips; then remove any foreign matter that may cause further damage.
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	This is the common method of suturing: once you have taken the needle and counted eyelets according to the size of the wound; then leave from the end of the rupture with your ring finger, holding the needle with another hand without putting wax on both ends of the thread, having two ends of the scissor blades apart, until it has penetrated one side; now add both ends of the thread and both ends of the scissors, making four orders.
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	Then secure the circuit of the needle with double wax, sometimes twice over, and then join both lips together suturing them decently; next leave some thickness of finger and insert another needle there, then tie it with wax just like the first needle; do not stop doing this if necessary with other needles until you have completed all contraction of the wound.
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	And it is not advisable to insert the needle at both ends of the proximal bone for fear that the flesh will be cut too lightly and the wound will open before healing.
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	And do not leave the stitches prolonged so that the wound is not prevented from healing.
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	Then trim the ends of the needles so that they do not hurt the patient while sleeping; you will place over the suture expanded powders from all quarters, which have the ends of the needles in them; and leave those there until you know the wound has healed.
E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.	And this type of suture with needles is most suitably done in small wounds, for there are only one or two needles used to close each wound.
Mays la segonda sutura es cominal: e es que tu aministres am sutura las quatre extremitatz, de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, en una veguada, am agulha en la qual sia fiel envolopat engual en subtilitat e grosseza.	The second suture is preferable: which you should administer with a single suture around the four edges of the proximal bone and two edges of the shaft, using one needle that must be threaded with string fine in texture and thickness.
E aprop quan am la agulha auras penetrat aquestas quatre extremitatz, reduzeys la agulha de aquela meteyssa partida de la qual comensest, per so que le fiel retrayt caja de la pus subirana partida a la plagua, per so que la sutura sia segon sutura de drap am la qual les draps so strengutz.	Then when you have pierced these four edges with the needle, bring back the needle from that same side it originated to draw the thread out of the most upper edge of the wound, so that the suture is like a piece of cloth sewn together where the threads are tightened.
E pausa entre quascuna sutura la quantitat del gros del dit mendre.	And place between each suture an amount equal to the thickness of the little finger.
E aquesta sutura sabo les homes.	This suture is known as 'the men's suture'.
E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.	With this suture, I closed the wound that had afflicted a man in his belly, which was caused by a stab from a knife, and it was a disruption of the major wound measuring more than one palm, with intestines protruding up to two palms outside the body cavity, and there was also a rupture in the middle of the member. So after the intestine had been exposed for twenty-four hours through that wound, I then reduced it.
E la plagua fo consolidada en le spazi de xv dias o entorn, e curegui aquel e es sanat; e aprop aquo visquec per motz ans, e es conversat en las suas disposicios.	The wound healed within fifteen days or thereabouts, and I treated him, and he recovered; and so for many years after this event, he lived a healthy life as before.
E les autres metges havian jutgat que no fora sanat; e per miracle foc, quar yeu no curegui aquel am enguent, quar era en loc en le qual enguent no era atrobat ni deguna medicina, mays pausegui sobre la plagua coto viel dos veguadas lo dia e ablucio assiduo am aygua de mel entro que foc sanat.	The other doctors had judged that he would not recover; and by miracle it happened, for I did not treat him with any ointment, as is customary, but instead I applied a clean cloth twice daily over the wound, and dressed it frequently with water mixed with honey until he was healed.
Mays yeu diyre dos specias de sutura proprias segon narracio de Paraula.	But I shall now describe two types of suture according to the account in the Bible.
E es que tu comenses am sutura de la codena, e entrometas agulha de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz.	And it is you who begins to suture the wound, and inserts the needle from the outside part to the inside.
E donc cum la agulha penetra en la codena e en aquel meteys lacertz segon rectetut e en longetut de tot le cos, e layssa la extremita del ciphac en le qual has entromesa la agulha; e fay penetrar en la autra extremitat la agulha de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo en l’autra extremitat del mihat.	Then, as the needle pierces through the wound and you make a cut according to its direction and length along the entire body, leave the tip of the thimble in which you've inserted the needle; and make the other end of the needle penetrate from inside to outside at the other end of the midpoint.
E don cum tu auras fayta aquela penetrar, lahoras tu fay aquela penetrar autra veguada en aquela meteyssa extremitat del mihat de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz; e leyssa la extramitat del ciphac que es en aquest latz, e fay penetrar la agulha en l’autra extremitat de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo.	And when you have completed that penetration, then make it penetrate again at the same midpoint extremity from outside to inside; and leave the thimble tip on this side, making the needle penetrate the other end from inside to outside.
E fay penetrar am aquela la tua penetracio am la qual fas aquela penetrar en le ciphac en la extremitat del mirat la qual es en la partida de lu entro que tot aquel penetre.	Make your penetration penetrate the thimble tip at the midpoint extremity which is on its inside so that everything penetrates.
E aprop comensa de aquest meteys costat e cus aquel am la extremitat que es del ciphac en l’autra latz, e extratz la agulha de la codena la qual penetrec, e aprop redutz aquela en aquela codena e cos la extremitat del ciphac que es en l’autra costat am aquesta extramitat del mirat; e extratz aquela de la codena la qual es de part de lu.	Then begin on this side and sew with the extremity of the thimble that is on the other side, withdrawing the needle from the wound which it pierces, then reduce it to that same wound and sew the thimble tip which is on the other side with this midpoint's end; withdraw it from the wound which is on its part.
E fay aquo una veguada e autra, e fay aquo una veguada aprop autre veguada entro que tu cozes tot aquo que es deforo segon aquel eysemple.	And do this once and then again, and do it one more time after that until you have sewn up everything outside according to the example.
E la suma de aquesta manieyra de sutura es que tu cozes am sutura de pellicies am la qual cozo las pels, enayssi que tu cozes le ciphac una veguada de la part de la extremitat de la codena, e que leysses aquela autra veguada entro que la ajas complida.	The summary of this suturing method is that you sew with a simple interrupted suture, which sews the skin together by catching each individual hair follicle. Thus, you can sew up one side of the wound before turning and sewing it completely.
Mays la segonda specia de sutura propria la qual dieys eyssament Gualia , e aquest es de sermo de lu e per lu recomtat, es que tu cozas aquela segon semilitut am la qual alcus medicantz cozo aquela, enayssi que agreguan tota partida a la sua compar partida a lu convenient per natura; e aplican la extremitat de autre de lu e la extremitat del mirat al autra extremitat de lu, e aquo es fayt segon que yeu a tu recomti.	The second type of suture that you see an example of in Guy de Chauliac's work is the continuous type where each stitch enters and exits either side of the wound, much like how stitches are placed on either side of a tear for a seamstress or tailor to mend it. This method ensures every part of the wound has been closed up by stitching opposing edges together.
Cove que tu fiques la agulha en la extremitat del mirat a tu propdana de la partida deforo, e fassas aquela penetrar a la partida dedintz en aquel sol, e leysses dos extremitatz del ciphac; e aprop revolveys la agulha e fay aquela penetrar de foro a la dedintz en dos extremitatz del ciphac.	Ensure that you leave the needle attached to one end of your suture at its entry point on the outside, and then push it through into the inside part, and pass both ends of the suture through; now turn the needle over and push it back from the inside out again, passing through both ends of the wound.
E aprop revolveys aquelas cascunas, e fay penetrar quascunas de la partida dededintz entro a la partida deforo en dos extremitatz del mirat autras que so en le latz contrari.	And then move each one of them, and make the two divided parts penetrate from inside to outside at the two ends of the wound that are on the opposite side.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura es milhor de la sutura comuna leugiera, e es sutura de la qual precedic rememoracio.	And this method of suture is better than the common light suture, which I mentioned earlier in my recollection.
Aquest es le sermo de Gualia	This is the work of Gualtius.
E mays le diyssero alcus, sutura del ventre es rectificada am dos agulhas, so es que tu entrometas en aquestas a quascunas un fiel, e comensa am intromiccio de agulha de aquo que es deves tu, e fay aquela penetrar entro al autra latz segon sutura de aquels les quals cozo les cuers engualment.	Moreover, they say that the suture of the abdomen is done with two needles, which you must insert a thread into each one and start with the insertion of the needle that you have to do first, then make it penetrate to the other side according to the method of suturing the flesh equally.
E sapias que quan disrupcio es en le mieg loc del ventre, lahoras la sutura de lu es pus difficil que dels autres locs del ventre.	And know that when the rupture is in the middle part of the abdomen, then its suture is more difficult than those of other parts of the abdomen.
Mays le juguament de medicacio de plagua es jutgament de las autras plaguas.	The treatment of plague is like the treatment for other diseases.
La qual causa es quar quan tu consieguas la plagua recent am le sieu sanc denant que l’ayre altera aquela, e reduses le budel e cozes aquela e aptas aquela decentment, lahoras pausa sobre aquela polvera encarnativa.	Whose cause is that when you get fresh plague with its blood before the air changes it and reduces the intestine and sutures it and adapts it properly, then place over it incarnative powder.
E si le ayre ja ha alterada la plagua, lahoras pausa sobre aquela alcus enguentz les quals so a tu presens entro que fassan peyra dura e cajan les fiels, e sian consolidatz ciphac e mirat; e aprop cura aquela ayssi cum es la curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
Mays si a tu no so presens las medicinas, lahoras pausa sobre aquela tantost, pus que comensa a getar brac, coto viel, e permuta aquel dos veguadas le dia, ayssi cum a tu e ensenhat, entro que sia sanat, quar tu no indigeysses de autra medicacio en motas disposicios quan las plaguas so simplas.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text: 
Mays si tu temes que la plagua comunique en lesio als membres principals, lahoras cove que tu submergas lana leon en oli de trempada qualiditat, o en oli rozat, e pausa aquela en le circuit dels locs que so entre les angonas e dejos las aysselas.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E si sent dolor o putrefaccio en les sieus budels, quar motas veguadas aquo s’endeve, lahoras cristeriza aquel am vi stiptic negre tebe, e majorment si la poyredura es pervenguda en le budel e es fayta exitura penetrant entro la conquavitat de lu.	Here is my translation of the provided text:
E sapias que aquela que es del budel gros es de pus leugiera sanacio que aquela que es en les budels subtils.	And know that an illness of a large intestine is easier to cure than one in the subtle intestines.
E es de dificil sanacio quar le budel le qual es apelat “gegunu” no recep sanacio de plagua que caja en lu de tot; e aquo es per la gran multitut de venas que so en lu e per la magnitut de lu que so en aquelas, e per subtilitat del cos de aquel, e per propinquitat de aquel a natura de nervis.	It is difficult to treat because the intestine called 'gegunu' does not heal from any external application; this is due to the large number of veins within it and their size, as well as the subtlety of its body and its proximity to nerves.
Mays si aquo que procezeys de la plagua es la tela, e conseguas aquela recent, redutz aquela segon la tua rectetut am la qual reduzes les budels engualment.	However, if what emerges from the treatment is a hernia, and it is fresh, reduce this in the same way you would reduce intestines using your own method.
Mays si es passat a lu spazi e ja es feyt vert o negre, lahoras que tu strenguas aquela am fiel sobre le loc que es denigrat de lu, per so que vengua fluxs de sanc, quar en la tela so venas e arterias.	But if it has passed its time and already turned green or black, then you must apply gall over the discoloured area to induce bleeding, for within a hernia there are veins and arteries.
E aprop inscideys aquo que es otra aquel liament, e pausa dos extremitatz del fiel pendentz de la partida dejos de la plagua foro lu, per que sobre tu sia alleujada la atraccio de lu deves le cazement de la tela e emissio del brac de la plagua.	Then slice away whatever is further attached to the hernia and hang two pieces of gall from either side of the incision below the treatment site, so that its attraction for you must be relieved by the removal of the hernia's head and discharge of its arm.
Rememoracio de las plaguas quan accideysso en le budel.	A reminder of the symptoms when this condition occurs in the intestines:
Quan accideys disrupcio en le budel e es petita, lahoras es possibla que sia resteurada en alcus homes, per aysso quar yeu vi aquel le qual era stat plaguat en le sieu ventre am percussio de lansa et era la plagua de la part dreyta del stomac, e la plagua era antiquada e fayta fistula, e eyssic de lu gestio e ventositat.	When a small rupture occurs in the intestine and is possible to be restored in some men, as I have seen one who was struck in his abdomen with a lance blow and had an old wound that became a fistula, and from him came pus and wind.
Adonc yeu pansegui la curacio de lu ja sia que no era confizat en la sanacio de lu, mays cessegui subtiliar aquel entro que foc sanat e le loc es consolidat.	I then pursued his treatment, knowing it was not certain for his recovery, but continued to apply a subtle remedy within that healed and the place became firm.
E yeu pus que vi le loc ja consolidat, timegui sobre le malaute que endevengues sobre lu accident de mal en le sieu ventre; e no endevenc alcu per aquo mal accident e romas en las suas milhos disposicios mangant e bevent, e aprop entrec en banh e es exercitat en sos ditz.	And when I saw the place healed and firm, I advised the patient to avoid any further accidents or harm to his abdomen; and not to indulge in any food or drink that may cause such a bad accident or rupture again, and also to abstain from baths and exercise for a while as directed.
E ja diysero alcus experimentados que quan endeve plagua en le budel, e es petita, lahoras cove que sia liada segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas fromiguas de grans caps; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua e pausa una fromigua de aquelas que aja la boca uberta sobre las doas labias de la plagua; donc quan pren sobre aquelas e strenh la sua boca, abscindeys le cap de lu, quar adhereys e no es dissolvut.	Some experienced individuals suggested that when treating a small rupture in the intestine, it is advisable to bind it in this manner: take large-headed pins; align the two lips of the wound and place one of those pins with an open head on top of both lips of the wound; as you press them together and close the pin's head, cut off its tip because it sticks and does not come apart.
E aprop pausa autra formigua prop la primieyra, e no cesses aquo a far am formiguas una aprop autra segon la quantitat de tota la plagua.	Then place another ant nearby the first one, and do not stop until you have made ants in succession according to the quantity of the entire wound.
E aprop reduzeys aquela e cos la plagua; e romanguan aquels caps annexces en le budel entro que·l budel sia sanat; e no accideys al malaute degun nocument.	Then reduce the size of the wound and cut away its edges; leave those adjacent veins inside the cavity until it has healed, and do not cause any harm to the patient.
E ja es possible que·l budel sia liat am fiel subtil lo qual es fayt del budel de bestia annexs am lu, pus que es mes en agulha; e es que tu prenguas la extremitat de aquestz fiels de budel, e sia mot descarnat, e aprop lia la extremitat de lu am fiel de li, envolopat, e aprop entromet aquel fiel en agulhas e cos am aquel le budel, e areduzeys aquel en la disrupcio.	And it is possible to sew the wound with a fine thread made from the intestines of an animal; since it is thinner than usual, you should take the end of these intestinal threads and strip them thoroughly, then tie their ends together with a knot, insert that thread through the needle, and use it to suture the wound, reducing its size.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura am formiguas no es sino segon via de fiducia e d’esperansa.	And this method of suture with ants is but the second way of achieving trust and hope.
Mays si la plagua es gran e ampla, majorment si es en un dels budels subtils, quar lahoras no es engen sino subtiliacio, e no es sanacio de lu de tot.	However, if the wound is large and wide, especially when it occurs on one of the delicate cavities, then this is not true healing but rather a subtle concealment, and it will not be completely cured.
De curacio de zuchem e fistula.	On the treatment of sores and fistulas:
Sapias que tota plagua e apostema quan se envilheseys e se Antiqua, e es fayt ulcus, e no es consolidat e geta braç tot temps e no es abscindit, lahoras, en qualque membre sia, universalment es nompnada fistula e nos la apelam aquela azukem.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E fistula segon veritat es nodacio feutrada, dura, blanqua am la qual no es dolor e a la qual es conquavitat ayssi cum es conquavitat de pena de ausel; e per aysso nompnat aquela alcus rizatz, id est pena.	Here is the translation of the first source sentence: 
E es en alcus homes humida, la qual geta brac; e fort leu la humiditat es abscidida en alcunas horas.	And in some men, it is moist, which causes weakness; and often the moisture is quickly drained away within a few hours.
E alcunas veguadas aquesta humiditat es mota, e es pauca, e es grossa, e es subtil.	And sometimes this moisture becomes visible; it is small in quantity, thick in nature, and subtle.
E yeu ja he denant dit en la divisio, lahoras cum yeu diyssi las plaguas, que tot ulcus que no es sanat ni no es en lu nuda carn, no es aquo sino per una de ix causas: de las quals la una es o per pauquesa de sanc en le cos; o per malicia de lu; o quar entre lu e las labias es carn dura prohibent nativitat de carn; o quar es de mota legesa; o quar aquel ulcus en si meteys es poyrit e la materia que es a lu tramesa es de mala qualitat; o quar la medicina es enconvenient en la curacio de lu; o quan corrupcio catz en la regio, e es pestilencia; o per proprietat de regio ayssi cum endeve a Saragossa , en la qual es fayta difficil degestio de las malautias, e es tardada en aquela sanacio de apostema per natura; o quar en lu es os un, o motz osses.	And as I have mentioned before in the division, when I talk about diseases, any ulcer that does not heal and remains uncovered with flesh is caused by one of these reasons: either due to a lack of blood in the body; or because of the patient's constitution; or there is hard tissue between them and the ulcers, preventing new flesh from forming; or it is caused by an excessive amount of thin material; or the ulcer itself has become rotten, and the matter within it is of poor quality; or the medicine being used is not suitable for their treatment; or when corruption spreads to the region, causing pestilence; or due to the nature of the area, as in Zaragoza, where digestion is difficult and the healing of abscesses takes a long time; or because there are one or many bones within them.
Ja e mostrat totas aquelas causas, e·ls senhals de aquelas e la curacio de lor am medicinas en la divisio.	I have already shown all these causes, their symptoms, and the treatment with appropriate medicines in the division.
E cove assi que yeu fassa a tu saber la curacio de fistula la qual es fayta per via de operacio am ma.	And now I will inform you about the treatment of fistulas, which are caused by surgical incisions with the hand.
E sapias que fistula accideys en totz les membres del cos; quar de aquelas son fistulas que perveno a las venas grantz e arterias, o als nervis, o al ciphac, o al budel, o a la vesica, o ad alcuna de las costas, o ad alcu dels spondils del dos, o ad alcuna de las juncturas compostas per composicio ayssi quo de la ma e del pe; e de aquelas so que dan a lu propinquitat del membre principal e de semblantz.	Know that fistulas can occur in any part of the body; some affect large veins and arteries, nerves, the spine, intestines, bladder, ribs, or the vertebrae of the back, as well as composite joints like those of the hand and foot. These are all located close to vital organs.
E donc aquela de aquestas fistulas que es segon aquesta manieyra es de las malautias de dificil sanacio, e no recep curacio, e occupacio am aquela es trebalh e ignorancia.	Therefore, these types of fistulas, which present in this manner, are among the diseases that are difficult to cure and do not respond well to treatment. Working with such ailments requires patience and a thorough understanding.
E si es de las fistulas alcuna la profunditat de la qual no perve ad aquestz locs que e dit, e esperas e confizas en la curacio de lu, e vols pervenir a cognicio de lu, lahoras pren tenta de eram o de ferr, e si la fistula va segon rectetut, e perquireys aquela am lu.	If there is any fistula that does not extend to these mentioned locations and you wish to proceed with its treatment confidently, then take a needle or iron tool. If the fistula follows a straight path, carefully probe it with the chosen instrument.
Mays si la fistula es tortuissitat, lahoras investigua aquela am tenta de plom subtil, quar plom am la levitat del sieu cors es alleujat e curvat deves la tortuositat.	However, if the fistula is curved or twisted, then use a fine lead probe as its lightness and flexibility will aid in navigating the curvature.
E si la fistula es havent motz horrificis, no es a tu possible que signifiques sobre lu am tenta.	And if the fistula has horrible discharges, it is not advisable for you to examine or touch them.
Adonc cristeriza le orrifici per sos orrificis, quar la humiditat per la qual clisterizas aquela va deves las autras orrificis e corr de lor.	Thus, close the orifice with its openings, for the moisture that comes out of it will affect the other orifices and run down from there.
E aprop inquier exquisitament, segon qual manieyra a tu es possible que conoguas si aqui has os o nervi, e es la conquavitat de la fistula longinqua o propdana, o es una fistula a la qual so motz orrificis e esta sobre aquo tot am la suma de la tua fortaleza, am la tua enterroguacio, am la qual enterroguas le malaute, e la invencio de la dolor deves la tua compressio am la ma sobre le loc, e semblantz de las significacios e de las causas accidentz al apostema.	Then carefully inquire and examine in which way you can know if there are bones or nerves, whether the cavity of the fistula is deep or shallow, or if it is a fistula with multiple openings that requires all your strength, attention, inquiry, and understanding of the patient's condition; and the discovery of pain through compression with your hand on the area, along with considerations about the symptoms and accidental causes related to an abscess.
E cum tu auras stat sobre totas aquelas causas am stacio veraya, lahoras ve a la curacio segon confidencia: e es que tu consideras lahoras si es fistula apparent propinqua o en loc sal, longinqua de junctura, o de nervi, o de arteria, o de vena, o de un dels locs les quals yeu a tu e ditz.	And once you have thoroughly assessed all those causes and made a proper diagnosis, proceed to the treatment according to your judgment: consider whether it is an apparent superficial fistula close to the surface or in salt locations, distant from joints, nerves, arteries, veins, or any of the other specific areas that I have mentioned to you.
Lahoras tu secca la fistula segon que denant es dit de la naracio de lu, e osta aquo que es en aquela filtracio e de carns corrumpudas, e aquo que es nascut en le orrifici de la carn, o de theil e de semblantz, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	Dry out the fistula as described earlier, remove whatever is in that discharge and any corrupted flesh, along with what has grown around the opening of the flesh or inside the wound itself; then treat it until it is completely healed.
Mays si la fistula es de longinqua profunditat, e es segon rectetut, lahoras cove que inscidas aquela en le preon atant quant a tu sira possible, e aprop mondifica aquela de totas las suas carns corrompudas; e aprop administra calguas envolopadas en medicinas acutas, e intromet aquelas entro a la conquavitat de la fistula, la qual has conprenduda am ferr.	Here is my translation of the provided text:
E fay aquo am aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la medicina acuta corroda tot aquo que es romas en la conquavitat de la fistula de la corrupcio.	And do this with some cautery wounds so that the sharp medicine can eat away all of the rotten material inside the cavity of the fistula's corruption.
E aprop restaura aquela am enguentz les quals engendran carn sana entro que sia sanada.	Then restore it with fire to generate healthy flesh so that it may be healed.
Mays si no es sanada per aquo, lahoras tu cauteriza aquela segon que havem recomtat.	If it is not healed by this method, then cauterize it as we have explained before.
Mays si la causa de fistula es os e es deves tu certificat aquo, lahoras tu inquireys aquela e secca aquela segon que havem recomtat, si tu no prohibeys alcuna causa de vena o de nervi o de membre principal ayssi cum havem dit.	If the cause of the fistula is bone-related and you need to verify it, then investigate that area and dry it out as we have explained previously, ensuring there are no issues with veins, nerves, or major organs/limbs, as mentioned before.
Mays si le os es a tu descubert e es en lu alcuna corrupcio e negror, lahoras tu ratz aquel entro que la corrupcio sia hostada tota; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que lu encarne entro que sia sanat.	If the bone is exposed and there are signs of corruption or blackening in it, then remove all that has been corrupted; and then treat it with something that will help flesh grow back so that it can be healed.
E si no es sana e gieta brac ayssi cum fazia, lahoras sapias que tu no est pervengut a la eradicacio tota de la corrupcio; e adonc tu descuebre sobre lu segondanament e exquisitament fay la razio de lu e la mundificacio de lu am la deriera fortalasa tieua, e aprop restaura aquel.	If it does not heal and the arm still falls off as before, then know that you have not fully eradicated the corruption; thus, you must uncover it again carefully, remove its cause, and thoroughly clean it with hot water, and then restore it.
E donc si es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras sapias que aquela corrupcio es en la profunditat longinqua del cors, la qual no ha conseguida, e adonc a tu en aquel no es engen sino laysar aquela.	And so if he is cured, it is good; and if not, then know that this corruption is in the distant depths of the body, which has not been reached, and therefore you have done your part, now it is up to fate.
E si le os corromput es petit, o es a tu possible atirar aquel, lahora tu le atira am forceps subtils las quals conveno ad aquo.	And if the corrupted bone is small, or it is within your capability to extract it, then you should do so with subtle forceps that are suited for this task.
E si so motz osses, lahoras exquisitament fay la extraccio de totz aquels, e de aquels no laysses denguna causa am la tua fortaleza.	And if there are multiple broken bones, carefully perform the extraction of all of them, and leave behind none of their causes or symptoms.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat alcuna causa de las humiditatz, e en lor inscizio no ha temor ni error, lahoras inscideys aquelas liaments o carns si so aqui, e deliura les osses.	But if any difficulty arises due to the presence of moisture, and in their examination there is neither fear nor mistake, then cut into those ligaments or flesh where they may be present, and deliver [relieve] the bones.
Mays si a tu no es preparacio de ostar les osses de la tua hora, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua aquo que poyresca la plagua aquela, e layssa aquela entro que aquo es al enviro de aquels osses de carns e de liamentz, e guarda la plagua que no sia consolidada, e sia constrengida la seccio la qual tu has inscidida en la tua operacio.	But if you are not prepared to reset the bones at this moment, then place on the wound something that will cause it to scab over, and leave this [the scab] over those bones of flesh and ligaments until they are ready for the resetting, and ensure the scab is not too thick or tight, and it should restrain the section you have cut during your operation.
Habantz, si temes, pausa sobre lu coto submers en sopre trissat am oli, o coto submers en anguent egipciac, o en alcu dels enguentz vertz, quar quan poyriran aquelas liaments, e les osses son de lor seperatz la ablacio, e de aquels atraccio es alleujada.	Firstly, if you have a fracture, apply warm oil or Egyptian ointment to the affected area, and use one of the green unguents; when they begin to soften those ligaments, and the bones are separated from each other, the ablation is done, and that traction is alleviated.
Mays si es un gran os ayssi cum le os de camba o de coyssa o semblantz ad aquels, e aquo que de lu es corromput es la facia de lu tant solament, lahoras ratz aquela am resio tant solament derriera entro que sia ostada aquela negror e corrupcio, e aprop restaura la plagua.	However, if it is a large bone such as the thigh or hip bone and only the outer layer of tissue has been corrupted, then clean that area thoroughly behind where the blackness and corruption are present, and restore the wound.
Mays si aquo que de lu es corrumpyt es gran partida, e la corrupcio ja ha conseguida la medulla del os, lahoras es causa necessaria cerrar aquel e aquel tot inscidir entro al loc on es pervenguda la corrupcio, e lahoras cura aquel entro que sia consolidada.	If a large part of the bone is corrupted and the corruption has reached its core, it is necessary to remove that piece entirely by cutting into the area where the corruption has spread; then treat it until it heals.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc ad un home en la sua coyssa per que pausez aquela a eyssempli e adjutori sobre la tua operacio.	And I recommend that you seek assistance from another man to support your hip and help you with this operation.
Foc un home jove per etat entorn xxx ans, al qual accideys dolor en la sua cueyssa, e de las partidas dedintz mauguda es sobre la materia dedintz le cors entro que la materia es pervenguda a la cueyssa, e es materia de apostema am gran apostema, e no foc a lu causa extrinseca.	It is a young man of around 30 years old who has pain in his hip; the cause is internal and located inside the body where matter has reached the hip; it's an abscess, quite large, and there was no external cause.
E adonc foc extendut le temps am aquela per la error dels metges entro que l’apostema es hubert, e acorrero de lu materias motas, e la sua curacio foc aprop pausada entro que la camba foc fistulada, e faytz son en lu motz orrificis les quals totz getavan poyredura e las humiditatz del cos.	Sure! Here is the translation of the given text:
E adonc le curec multitut de metges entorn dos ans, e no foc en aquels savia ma en la art, entro que yeu fu appelat.	And then for two years the patient was treated by many doctors, but there was no improvement in his condition until I was called upon.
E vi la camba de lu e las materias que corrian de lu aquels orrificis per gran cors; e ja le cos de aquel home era tot stabozit e la color de lu era citrina.	I examined his legs and noticed the discharge flowing from various openings in his body; his flesh was completely discolored, and he had turned yellow.
E adonc yeu intromesi la tenta ad un de aquels orrificis e pervenguec la tenta al os.	I then inserted the probe into one of those openings and managed to reach the bone.
E aprop yeu e perscrutat tostz les orrificis e trobegui aquels pervenir a lor de totas partidas de la camba.	I carefully examined all the openings and found them connected to each other from various parts of the leg.
E adonc yeu me coytegui e inscidegui sobre un dels orrificis aquels entro que descrobegui una partida del os, e atrobegui aquel corromput, e ja era terros e corrumput e denigrat; e era ja corrumpuda una partida de la camba entro que havia penetrat entro a la mezola.	I made an incision over one of the openings, exposing a part of the bone, and discovered it was corrupted—already hardened, decayed, and blackened. A portion of the leg had become infected due to the penetration into the marrow.
E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.	Then I seized what was revealed and exposed to me, the prepared and uncovered bone.
E yeu cujegui que no fos en le os sino aquela corrupcio la qual abscidigui e serregui, e yeu ja havia derraziguada.	I realized that it was not in the bone itself but rather this corruption, which I had already cut away and removed.
E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.	And then I paused the restoration of the wound with consolidating medicine for a long time, but it is not consolidated.
E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os.	And then I retraced my steps and uncovered the area again on top of the first uncovering, and I found continuous corruption in the bone.
E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat.	I clamped what appeared to be the corrupted part, and then I was forced to perform its cure and restoration, but it is not restored.
E adonc yeu descubri sobre lu autra veguada e no cessegui inscidir le os petit a petit particuladament e perforsa la restauracio de lu, e no es restaurat entro que inscidigui entorn un palm de lu, e aquel extraxi am la medula sua, e aprop restauregui aquel am medicinas, e es consolidat leugierament e sanat.	And so I uncovered it again and did not cease to carefully carve the bone little by little and perforate its restoration, but it is still not restored even though I carved around a palm's width of it, then I extracted its marrow with appropriate tools and restored that with medicine, and it consolidated lightly and healed.
E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala.	And no further operation or cutting is necessary unless for the position of its veins and because of its lack of endurance and fear of death since fainting befalls it at all hours due to excessive loss of blood.
E donc sanat es per sanacio entiera, e nada es en loc de os carn dura; e es fayta bona la disposicio de lu en le sieu cors e retornec la vertut de lu; e es conversat en las suas disposicios e no fec a lu contrarietat en ambulacio ni nocument en denguna causa.	And so it is entirely healed, and there is nothing in place of hard flesh or bone; its order has been well-established within its body and its strength returned to it; and now it can be used as before without causing trouble while walking nor harm in any way.
Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	Here is the translation of the first source sentence: 
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	Underneath place a piece of wood or table, for when you do this, it is not prohibited to use the saw and cut away corrupted flesh.
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	Cover the affected area with the sawdust from the previous cut, because if there is any corruption or infection within the cavity of the bone that has not yet appeared on its surface, it will force you to saw and cut again in the future.
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	If the bone is corrupted but not prominent or protruding, and the corruption continues from one section to another, with the infection being either in the middle of the bone or towards its end, you must remove all flesh covering it entirely; then place a piece of wood underneath, and saw the first infected part before continuing with cutting away the healthy part.
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	The sawing process will be small in size according to the location of the infection or corruption, as we have previously mentioned.
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	If the infection is located in a joint, cut away the corrupted joint itself, then saw the bone from where it connects to another section of the body.
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	If the corruption or infection is located between two joints (not within a single joint), it is not natural but rather an unnatural occurrence caused by some artificial process.
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	Here is my line-by-line translation of the provided text: 
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia. E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	And I will now present you, at the end of this chapter, with a list of instruments which you will need along with herbs; these shall be used in procedures during your learning process.

Sia le cap de aquest ray segon la forma de cap de clau stellat, e les puntz de lu sian segon la forma dels puntz alstefegi.	Let the head of this rasp be shaped like a star-shaped key, and its points follow the form of the spikes on an acanthus leaf.
E no conveneys sino que am aquel sian confricadatz les caps de las juncturas quan so corrumpudas, o es la boca gran ampla.	And it is not suitable to use these [instruments] only by rubbing the joints when they are corrupted or have a wide mouth.
