Forma de ray lo qual conveneys a rasio de aquel que es perforat dels osses:	Form of the chisel which corresponds to that of the perforated bone:
E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And its end is triangular with a sharp point.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	And it is made of Indian iron, and resembles all the causes we have mentioned regarding razors, incision tools, and saws.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	Regarding incisions at the ends of bones and locking them in place.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	Here is the translation of your provided text: 
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	And similarly, if it is caused by the poisonous sting of a scorpion or a viper or a weasel or something similar.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or sting is located at the tip of the finger, then you must cut into the finger to prevent the infection from spreading deeper into the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	Similarly, if it reaches the hand, you must cut it at its root from the forearm, without giving any space for the infection to enter and spread into the arm.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if not that, then cut it from the arm to the shoulder at its joint.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	If it passes further and surrounds the shoulder, then it is the death of the patient; and to administer another cause for curing this is a matter of great difficulty.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	Similarly, do this for the foot when the infection passes from the toe; then you must cut it before one of the joints.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if it reaches the arch of the foot, then you must cut off the entire foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	But if you can enter from above, then cut open the thigh up to the hip joint.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if the corruption has already reached the hip, then there is no cure but release; let the patient pass away.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	The way to cut open the limb or perform a dissection is as follows: you tighten one ligature below the part where you want to cut, and place another ligature over that area; extend a minister's hand with a ligature to the lower parts, and have another minister extend their hand above; then separate the flesh between the two ligatures with a sharp knife until all the flesh is exposed; after this, it can be cut or dissected.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And ensure that clean linen cloth is placed over all areas to prevent any contact with the wound, and have a tight bandage applied to the patient, covering any sores or abscesses.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	However, if there is bleeding while you work, cauterize the wound immediately or apply some powders that will help stop the blood flow; then return to your medical procedure until it is complete.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Then bind the wounded limb with an appropriate ligature until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And that corruption spreads first into his navel, which affects the whole foot.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	Then this man is prepared to undergo treatment by applying something that will bring the cure to the affected limb with such intensity and force that it overcomes his pain and inflammation, he then incises that foot at the joint, and he was healed.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	For a long time, it happened to him that the same corruption would occur in his right hand's navel.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And then he came to me, and I had to make him undergo the reverberation of that excess by applying what I put on my own hands as a physician; this was the purification of his body, but the excess did not reverberate, and it started going to another navel, starting from his left hand.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	He called on me to incise his hand, but I did not want to do this, hoping for a reverberation of that excess, and more so because I feared the incision into his hand might be fatal; because the strength of the disease was at its peak.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And because he departed from me, he returned to his land and I heard that this man was prepared and incised his entire hand; and he was healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	Here is my translation of the first source sentence:
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	But if the space is prolonged and corruption begins in any member, then it is called a fistula, not gangrene.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	And the cure for it is to insert that thread entirely as it is rolled up, especially when it is softened and made with cloth, and make sure it does not stick to the area due to corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	However, if you hope that the thread will adhere and prevent further consequences of corruption, and if the thread has passed through smoothly without any issues, then your cure is to use an enema.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And if you consider the sinuses, and they are large with an arm that exudes foul odor, then treat it with an Egyptian enema made of oil, vinegar, and pounded resin mixed together in equal parts and placed in a vessel to be heated over fire until the mixture becomes thick like honey.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	Then take what is necessary and dissolve it in water and honey; use that to administer an enema to the sinus, close off its opening, and leave the medicine inside for a period of two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	And then remove that with contempt; do so for as many days until the sinus is clean and the pus has subsided.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	In some cases, an enema is administered with water and ash when this medicine is not available to you; take the ashes of the fig tree and mix them with water; then use it to perform the enema until you find that the sinus has healed.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	If the patient cannot tolerate Egyptian medicine nor water and ash, then perform an enema with warm water and honey mixed together; also do this with wine and honey blended, for it is the nature of honey to clean and wash, while the wine makes the sinus adhere, especially when there's a surplus of astringency and dryness in the wine.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And when you do this a few times and find that the pus has subsided, then perform an enema with water that promotes the growth of flesh.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	Take some dauphine ointment and dissolve it with rose oil and astringent wine, or whatever enemas and ointments you have that possess the properties I've already written about in the treatise on ointments.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text:
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	And if the opening is wide, then you should gather its lips with stitches and leave it open for an amount that allows the entrance of a clyster.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the opening through which the arm passes is elevated towards the upper parts, then dry it in the lowest place possible so that the arm can go inside; for when the arm is constricted within the depth of the wound, flesh forms there.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if it is not possible for you to dry the wound at its lowest point, then you have to prepare the member with a preparation that allows the arm to pass through lightly as per your convenience and without any obstruction.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	Take consolidating medicines that are placed on the wound conveniently for what you want to extend them onto a linen cloth.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And let the cloth be of such a large quantity that it covers all the wound; then cut with scissors right at the opening of the wound a piece slightly wider than its own opening; and extend over another linen cloth of ignited lions according to the size of the piece, place it on top away from the opening of the wound so as to separate the emergence of the arm and do not change the large cloth but rather after some days.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	Now for the first source sentence to translate: But he who is above the wound of the chest, you must constantly press on it so that this does not come out what is adjusted in his arm.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And to know whether what comes out of his arm is a lot or a little, or if it is digested or undigested.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And you should consider the area around the wound; whether the patient feels pain there or not, and if it has developed an abscess.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And when your treatment has been prolonged in this way, and you see that the matter which is discharged over the wound has already formed a crust or an appropriate adherence, then on the third day, you can remove it or release the sutures; and when you clean the sore, change the cloth for a new one and renew the ointment.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	But if from the wound a thin and subtle fluid flows out of it, do not despair about its adherence or crusting; for some people are just like that in their healing process, as with those whose flesh grows slowly in their sores, while others heal contrarily.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if after many days, undigested arm still discharges from the wound, then you will know that it has not adhered or crusted over; and if this adherence of the wound is delayed due to a prolonged cause, then you must apply drying medications; and if your medicines are moist in their substance and in their virtue, they should be made dry like an ointment of diachylon, when there is too much moisture added to it.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	The last treatment I have for him is to take some daffodil ointment and dissolve it in rose oil, then spread it on his body just like you would with any other ointment, after which you should apply this mixture to him and use it regularly.
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	He should pretend to do the following action when there is no arm involved: take daffodil ointment and mix it with coagulated honey, then apply this mixture; or alternatively, you can grind myrrh, aloe, and resin into a powder over fire, mix it with honey that has been boiled until thickened, spread it on a cloth, and place it over the affected area. Spread this mixture over a cloth and place it firmly on the wound.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	Sometimes, you can administer to him long aristology roots and celestial lily (which is a celestial lily) along with the flour of herbs and centaurea. Use these simple or composite plants by grinding them into a powder and then mixing this powder with the honey that has been previously boiled; finally, apply this mixture.
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	If the wound is prolonged and does not heal with this treatment, then you should know that the corruption has spread to his bones or other hard tissues such as joints or ligaments. In this case, treat him with the fistula cure, as described above.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione translates to "On the treatment of an ingrown toenail, nail bed injury, and finger amputation.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	Panarici is an abscess that occurs near the nail of the thumb on the hand or toe, and occasionally it may appear on other fingers as well. When it becomes prolonged and its treatment is less successful, it either develops into a confined abscess or becomes corrupt, leading to infection at the root of the nail, which may spread throughout it entirely, causing its destruction. Often, this process progresses until it reaches the bone, where it emits an odorous smell due to corruption, resulting in discolouration and deformation of the affected finger's tip.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	And when you have the aforementioned condition from the previous division and your treatment is ineffective, it becomes necessary to incise with an iron needle all superfluous matter remaining near the nail bed and then cauterize the wound immediately afterward, as cauterization is particularly beneficial in this case.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	If the bone is sound and the nail bed healthy but its margins compress nearby flesh, causing it to become irritated or lacerated as a result, then you must apply a thin blade under the edge of the nail that penetrates said tissue, easing its incision; thereafter place on what remains of the flesh some corrosive caustic substances so that all is thoroughly dissolved. Cure this with ointments until healed.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	But if the corruption has already reached the bone, then it is necessary that you incise the bone and extract it, for there will be no healing as long as the corrupted bone remains.
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you see the corruption spreading to the fingers and toes, then incise one of the joints where it is affected by memory loss, and treat it until it heals.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	But if there is an injury or abrasion on the nail and it causes severe pain, then you must first bloodlet the patient, and then dry up the nail by cutting across its width with a sharp spatula, being careful not to penetrate into the flesh beneath the nail, for this will cause intense pain and may lead to the formation of unnecessary hard tissue in that area; treat that location with something that provides relief from pain.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	This newly formed tissue, which is born in the hands of some men, is mostly soft flesh and has few bones or nails.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	Some of these growths appear at the base of joints or are born within some of the aforementioned fingers.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	May he who is born with no growths on his fingers not be ill, and he who is born with weak joints will easily become sickly.
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	And for those who are born with fleshy bodies, the incision is shallow; you must cut their flesh with a wide blade.
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	May the cure be difficult for him who is born with a deformity in his joints, so beware of cutting into him.
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	May he who is born with bumps on his fingers be cut at the start of treatment with a round incision into his bone; then saw it shut with one of those saws suitable for this, and then treat him so that he may heal.
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	May the fusion of these fingers that occurs due to visible growths or by birth in a man who is born this way, or through the consolidation of a wound or burning from fire, or something similar, be cut so that these fingers return to their natural form.
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	And place the patient between soft cloths dipped in rose oil so that their fingers do not fuse lightly, and separate those fingers with a thin lead sheet until they are fused as is necessary.
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	And similarly, if hardening occurs in certain areas with the palms, then you must dry out that hardened area according to how it was prepared and is suitable for the shape of the body part.
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	On incisions in veins, if there are varicose veins..." 
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Here is my translation of the provided text:
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	Therefore, you must administer a strong purge of black bile from the heart several times and then bleed the patient by opening their basilic vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	The treatment of their wounds is done in two ways: one is by incising the wound and drawing out the black blood, while the other method involves elevating the vein and extracting all of it.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The sectioning is done in this way: first, immerse the leg in warm water until the thick blood from the wound settles and becomes cloudy. Then, bind the patient's leg firmly above the hip joint and below the knee with a bandage, and then cut the vein at one or more places with a wide incision. Next, direct the black blood downwards towards the leg, allowing it to drain out as much as desired and required until the strength of the patient returns.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	Then bind it up and instruct them to abstain from foods that produce black bile.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	And repeat the treatment with bloodletting through phlebotomy when the veins become full, as this will be noticed by the patient.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	Here is the translation of your first provided source sentence: 
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	And then bind the cord on the right of the vein by cutting it in the loin or at its back end; you should cut it below if there is an ulcer.
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	And then open the cord with hooks and scrape out the vein until it is felt; you must see its appearance as it turns towards blackness.
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And so, when you remove the cord and see that it is white like a thread...
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	Then place the reed below it until it is raised and turned away from the cord, and suspend it with hooks above a fire.
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	And then make another cut close to that cut for three fingers, and scrape out the cord from above the vein until it appears.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	Then lift it and cut it behind the lower section, then remove it and raise it through the second section, and finally extract it from the section above it.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	Do this until you extract it from the highest or uppermost section of all, once everything has been exposed; then cut it.
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	Here is my translation of the provided text:
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	Make sure it is not cut; for if it is broken, you will find it difficult to lift that body and it has come upon the patient because of that damage.
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And when all that has been done, place over the wound a piece of cloth soaked in wine and both rose oil and non-rose oil; heal that which is healed.
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	And if the life is contracted having a curvature that wraps around its parts and it does not regain rectitude as we have said, you must make an incision over all of its curved parts and their wrapping places; then suspend it with hooks until you elevate all of it.
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	And be careful that your section does not cut the vein and infect it, as it will be difficult for you to elevate it; use your discretion in this matter.
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	The form of the instrument that incises the dried vein:
Forma de unci orp:	Form of a body hook:
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	It is not as curved as hooks nor does it have an acute end so that it doesn't infect the vein; and its flexibility is thick, for if it were slender, it would cut the vein due to its thinness; there is a superfluous thickness in it as we said.
De extraccio venae cruris.	De extraccio venae cruris translates to "The extraction of the leg vein.
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is formed in the legs in low-lying lands, as observed by Al-Ategi in the Arabian regions and in the lowlands of India that are dry, with little vegetation, and where there is neither grass nor breeze.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	And it is rarely formed in other parts of the body besides the legs.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	Its conception is from putrefaction, just as poisonous snakes, worms, and frightening creatures come below the earth's surface, bringing forth maggots between the filth and flesh.
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	A sign of the occurrence of this condition is when there is a severe inflammation in the leg, and blisters form on it. Then, from that blistering area, a vein starts to emerge, resembling the roots of a plant.
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	Once you notice the extremity of this condition, take a piece of lead that weighs one to two drachmas and wrap it around there, leaving the lead suspended from the leg.
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	And whenever it brings forth any discharge from the affected area outside the body, wrap this [discharge] in lead and attach it there.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	So it is necessary that it be treated intensively and gradually extracted while being pushed outside from behind him so as to not leave any cause of the disease within his body.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And from this vein, there are some men who claim to have it running for 10 feet or more in their body and I myself have heard of one whose vein was as long as 20 feet.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	And if it is incised during its treatment, insert a rod in the opening and bore that rod through his body until everything in the matter has been evacuated, apply some putrefaction to the area for several days using medicine; then treat it with the cure of abscesses.
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	This vein has been known to have several branches and especially when it appears at the joint of the foot or in the foot itself; many openings appear to him, from which a branch is said to emerge.
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	Treat it as we have described in the section about its division, and with what has been mentioned above.
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	Regarding the section on worms generated under the skin, it is called bovine illness.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	Here is my attempt at translating the text line by line: 
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	The translation of your provided text is as follows:
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	Here is my translation of the provided text:
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	If it is embedded in the flesh and you cannot find it, then place a hot cautery on the spot where it lies until it dies down, and the most feared consequence is that corruption of his which corrupts the affected area as we have said.
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	But if you see that it has reached the top of his head, then press hard on the eyebrow with strong compression, and let this pressure be continuous until it is extracted; and ensure that the patient takes medicines to cleanse their body of foul and putrid humours, and take care not to eat foods which cause decay.
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	On the operation for nasal disease.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This disease is called 'nafir' in our land, and it is a pain that affects some members of the body, moving from member to member.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	I have already seen one like this which I will describe to you.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	I was called to attend a sick woman in a village, and I examined her arm, seeing a small inflammation on the vein of the upper arm; because it had been bruised for an hour, I saw that inflammation spread thus as if it were vermillion running from place to place more lightly than could be seen with the eye, like live silver when it flows from one spot to another.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	And then go towards that painful area and apply a hot compress, and leave it there for one hour.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	Then turn the other body over until you reach the other arm.
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	Then ask me to turn him over again, as I saw, and he moved his body swiftly from one side to the other, which was quite astonishing.
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	I had seen this before in my practice, following that method, but I have seen many cases where the pain shifts from one part of the body to another.
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	I have not seen this happen in my practice with female patients.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	I don't think this is the case; rather, it may be because the female patient was elderly and had thin skin with visible veins, which made her more susceptible to feeling such shifting sensations.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	It is important to note that this treatment approach should not be applied to those with delicate constitutions or moist bodies, as their veins may be more fragile and prone to damage.
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	And when you want to treat the patient and they experience pain during the process, if the scent is not as strong as mentioned earlier, then press firmly on that area but gently release it so that the wind is let out gradually, and cauterize the spot.
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquellas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.
De extraccio de sagetas.	De extraccio de sagetas means "On the extraction of arrows." 
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Arrows are diversified according to their species and the parts of the body they hit as these vary in size having big points or small ones, being concave or blunt, solid or hollow, three-cornered or with tongues attached, winged or plain.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	An arrow that has hit any of the vital organs in the body does so in two ways: when it hits major organs such as the brain, heart, liver, lungs, kidneys, intestines, bladder or similar parts; and therefore, if an arrow lodges in one of these organs and you see signs of imminent death, which I will explain later, then you must avoid extracting that arrow since for the victim death would come more quickly than it would were the arrow left inside them, and when none of those bad signs are visible and the arrow has not penetrated deep into the organ, then you may extract the arrow and treat the wound.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	The signs that an arrow has hit the brain are as follows: when it pierces the bone and emerges from the cranium above the cerebrum because there is bound to be a vehement headache, blindness, dizziness, pain in the eyes, inflammation and pain of the tongue, spasms and derangement of intellect, vomiting bile, severe difficulty speaking and loss of voice; also, at the site of the wound white moisture resembling dust exudes from it as well as watery fluid from the flesh.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	And so if these signs appear to you, then abstain from the cure and extraction of the arrow, unless otherwise advised.
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	However, the signs of the arrow when it lodges in the heart are as follows: if it is close to the left nipple, and you feel that it has stuck in hard tissue, not visible flesh; and note that its movement resembles the pulse, and dark blood flows from the wound, along with coldness in the extremities, pale sweating, and fainting; therefore, know that death descends swiftly upon them soon after.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	And the signs when the arrow has pierced the lung are an effusion of frothy blood from the wound, and the vessels near the neck become inflamed, the patient's complexion changes, they exhale a great spirit, and crave cold air.
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	If the arrow strikes the covering that is on the foot, and the pain then extends to the small ribs, making a loud noise with intense pain and sighing, but all the body's muscles are not harmed.
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	And if the arrow pierces the stomach, often some undigested food comes out from the wound.
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text into English: 
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text: 
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa. E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	And I will recount this to you about what I have witnessed regarding these arrows, so that you may understand its significance in terms of gentle healing.
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	Which is caused by an arrowhead lodged in the temple of a man near his nose's root; I extracted it from another part of his head, leaving a wound behind his ear, yet he healed and suffered no further injury to his temple.
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas. E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	The Jew is healed, and he suffered no further harm to his eye.
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia . E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	And therefore, I say that arrows are not extracted from the body parts they have pierced but rather in two ways: either through the attraction of the place where they enter or by acting against another part.
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	The one that is extracted by the place it has entered, or an arrow going into a fleshy part, is pulled and drawn out.

And if it does not obey the exit of the hour in which you extract it, then it is necessary to leave it for a few days until the flesh around it swells and its attraction and exit are alleviated.

Similarly, if an arrow is embedded in the bone and does not yield to your extraction attempt, then leave it for a few days and repeat the process of attraction and motion every day until it can be drawn out.
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	And if it still does not yield after a few days, then you must pierce the arrow's path in that bone from all sides with a fine taravel (a type of tool) until the space around the arrow is enlarged, and then extract it.

If the arrow is lodged in the bone of the head and has already penetrated one of the cavities of the brain, and if the patient experiences any of the accidents I have mentioned before, then refrain from extracting the arrow and let it be until their condition stabilizes after a few days; for if the arrow pierces the medulla, death will not be prolonged.
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu. Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	Certainly! Here is the translation of your provided text: 
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	Under these conditions you cannot act on him either because of the constriction caused by the wound or due to the length of the arrow shaft, and if there is no bone or nerve nor vein present, then make an opening in the wound so that it can be enlarged enough to allow extraction of the arrowhead.
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	And if there is an arrow that has penetrated his ears, then you must remove the flesh in which it is embedded with all the force and skill you can muster; and be inventive about this, for if you cannot act on him because of the constriction caused by the wound or due to the length of the shaft, and if there are no bones or nerves nor veins present, make an opening in the wound so that it can be enlarged enough to allow extraction.
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.	When you are extracting the arrowhead from any location it may be in, use your hand and forceps to twist with all your strength so that the arrowhead will yield; and be subtle with extreme subtlety so that the arrowhead is not broken during this difficult process of drawing out both it and the shaft.
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.	And if you cannot extract the arrowhead right now, then leave it in place for a few days until the surrounding tissue has had time to relax, and then repeat this procedure when things have eased up.

E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	Be mindful of your skill in incising veins, nerves, or tendons and manage the extraction of the arrowhead with all possible means at your disposal. E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	And thus you should position the patient in such a way that the arrowhead is contracted according to the figure which shows how to find the location of the arrowhead within them, for this is most beneficial.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	But if that is not feasible for you, then administer what is possible according to the figures.
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	For arrowheads that are bent outward due to the opposite part, or which have already caused some damage to the external parts, or which cause swelling in the extremity of the arrowhead upon feeling the part above the wound and sometimes protrude from it; you should cut into them there; and let the incision be according to the quantity with which the forceps take hold; then pull on it, for it is easily removed by pulling outward.
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	If it is retained in the bone, then you must move the arm according to opposition until the arrowhead presses on the bone and enlarges its wound, then extract it.
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	Otherwise, leave it for a few days, and then try again until it comes out.
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	And if the shaft of the arrow is inside, then you must push it with your hand.
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	But if the shaft has fallen out and you wish to administer a push, then introduce your concave instrument into its tail and push it with your hand.
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	But if the arrowhead is concave, then you must push it with a strong instrument that enters it, for the arrowhead is relieved by this.
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	And if the arrowhead is poisoned, then you must ensure that you concave all of the flesh around it, as far as possible, and then treat it with whatever seems suitable to you.
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the arrowhead is near a foot, or in the abdomen, or bladder, or side, and it is accessible so that you can touch it with a tent pole, and it is possible to cut around it, then do so while being careful not to cut any veins or nerves. Extract it, then sew up the wound if necessary, and treat it until it heals.
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	Here is my translation of your provided text: 
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text: 
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquella sorda:
Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:	Method for driving out an extreme case of deafness:
ayssi cum ray per so que sia alleujat le intrament de lu en la sageta concava e es impellida am aquel.	In this way, you will ease the movement of the intestine into its concave cavity and push it in.
De fleubotomia de las venas.	On venesection (bloodletting) from the veins:
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so xxx, de las quals so en le cap xvi, so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua.	The veins that are commonly used for bloodletting, as mentioned in chapter xvi, include two pulse points located near the ears (called alhasisain); two herbs appearing on each temple; two veins at the inner corners of the eyes, which are known as 'aspicientz'; a vein positioned in the middle of the forehead; and a vein found at the tip of the nose. Additionally, there are two jugulars situated by the neck; two veins on the upper lip; two veins on the lower lip; these latter veins are called "angelic"; and finally, there are two veins beneath the tongue.
Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so v; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps.	The veins in the arms that are typically used for bloodletting are five in number: one is the cephalic vein, which some call the 'wild latz'; people often refer to it as the 'head vein', and is a silent/hidden vein; another is the median cubital vein, composed of a branch from the basilic vein and another from the cephalic; locals name this the 'vein of the whole body'. The basilic vein lies in the domestic latz and is known as the 'tickling' or 'itching' vein by some, while others call it the 'belly vein'; there's also the brachial vein that sits above the elbow (where bloodletting occurs) and becomes visibly apparent when it appears on the biceps; the salvage vein lies between the auricular digit (little finger) and its smaller counterpart, containing two branches.
E en le pe e la camba so tres venas; la una de aquelas es que es dejos la curvatura del denolh del latz silvestre; e la segonda es sophena, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz domestic; e la vena sciatica, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz silvestre; e en la camba son autras venas semblantz ad aquelas.	Here is the translated version of the first source sentence: 
Le juvament de las venas que so aprop las aurelhas es a cataris antics e emigranea e sahafati e ulceracios del cap malas antiquas.	The treatment of veins near the ears is for ancient cataracts, eye infections, and old wounds and ulcers on the head.
E la qualitat de sagnar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: es que sia ras le cap del malaute, e sia freguat le cap del malaute en le occipiti en le loc de amdoas las venas am drap ample am bona fricacio; aprop strenha le malaute le sieu col am una benda entro que apparan las doas e les locs de lor so aprop las aurelhas en dos locs depremegutz del cap; e quereys aquela am le tieu dit, e si tu sentes le pols de aquelas am le dit tieu, aqui senha am tenta.	The method of bleeding these veins is as follows: first, shave the patient's head, and then rub their head vigorously at the occiput where both veins are located. Next, bind the patient's neck tightly with a cloth bandage until the two spots behind each ear appear depressed in the skull; touch those spots with your finger, and if you can feel the pulse of the veins beneath your fingertip, proceed.
Aprop tu pren la lancea cutellar, e es aquela que es inscident, e aprop tu intromet aquel dejos la vena en la codena entro que·l fleubotomi vengua al os.	Then take the lancet, which is sharp and pointed, and carefully insert it beneath the vein in such a way that the phlebotomist can reach it with his/her mouth.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am la vena e la codena a las partidas desus e inscideys la vena am inscizio inscident.	And then lift your hand up to the vein and handle, separating them slightly with an incision made by a sharp instrument.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio la quantitat de dos ditz ajustatz o entorn de aquo; e fay yssir del sanc atant quant voles.	Let the length of the incision be about two fingers in size or thereabouts, and let as much blood flow from it as you wish.
E aprop strenh am pulvils e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then bind the wound with powder and leave it to heal on its own.
E ja e precedit en le comensament del libre la inscizio de aquelas e de lor la cauterizacio.	And in the beginning of this book, there is a description of the incision and cauterization of these [diseases].
Mays de las doas venas arterias que so als templars le juvament de la fleubotomia es a emigranea antiqua e sode malvada e obtalmia assidua e cors de superfluitatz acutas effusas als huels.	The two arterial veins that are beneficial for bleeding in bloodletting are the old temple vein and the evil one, as well as the frequent eye vein and the heart from acute overflowing superfluities.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: constrengua le malaute le sieu col mot entro que apparan las doas venas al sentiment per appericio manifesta e sia demonstrat le pols de lor dejos le tieu dit; e lahoras tu senha am tenta.	And the quality of bloodletting from these veins is as follows, which I recommend to you: constrict the patient's collar with your hand until both veins appear visible and are demonstrated by the pulse felt under your finger; then you shall begin.
E aprop tu eleva la codena desobre la vena a las partidas desus am le tieu dit indic, e intromet le fleubotomi inscident dejos, e eleva la vena en sus; e inscidey aquela ayssi cum has fayt en las doas venas autras; e fay correr del sanc segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	Then you lift your thumb off the vein at its parting above with the index finger, insert the bloodletter underneath, and raise the vein upwards; then cut it as you have done with the other two veins, and let the blood flow according to the quantity of your need.
E aprop deslia la coartacio del malaute, e pausa le tieu dit sobre la vena per una hora, e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto e pulvils e strenh aquela desus am fort constriccio, e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then release the patient from the constriction, place your finger on the vein for an hour, then put a pad and bandage over it, tightly bind it with strong pressure, and leave it until it is healed.
E ja es precedida la rememoracio de lor, e de aquelas la inscizio, e la atraccio en le comensament del libre.	E ja es precedida la rememoracio de lor, e de aquellas la inscizio, e la atraccio en le comensament del libre.
E donc le juvament de fleubotomia de la vena del front es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a las malautias antiquas de la cara e a emigranea e rogor e ulceracios fetidas. E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es segon que yeu recomti a tu; so es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col am una benda entro que apparesca la vena; e aprop pren le insturment le qual es nompnat fossori del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	Here is the translation of the provided text:

And the quality of bloodletting is that the patient should keep their neck wrapped with a bandage, then you perform phlebotomy on them while standing above their head.
E sia fayta la fleubotomia segon le transvers a longitut un pauc am fleubotomi pauc, quar en le loc no es carn; e si le fleubotomi es subtil, fort leu la extremitat de lu es trencada. Mays le fleubotomi de la vena del nas es conferent a febre acuta e a soda vehement, e a las malautias de la cara e emigranea e rogor que accideys en la cara, e majorment quan es antiqua.	The bloodletting of the vein in the nose is suitable for acute fever and violent headaches, as well as diseases of the face, migraine attacks, and especially when they are chronic.

And the quality of this patient's bloodletting is that they should keep their neck wrapped and then hold your left hand to their nose; take a subtle long lancet and place it in the middle of the root of the nose according to its straight line, as the vein does not appear palpable here, but soon enough you'll see the blood flowing.

Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de las doas guidegui a constriccio de ale e a comensament de lepra e a motas malautias e inpetige e malas ulceracios corrosivas ayssi cum herpotromeno. E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que el malaute strenha dejos quascuna en le sieu col am liament; e estia le artifexs sobre le cap del malaute, e le malaute sia sezent sobre una sezela.	The procedure of bloodletting with these two lancets is such that the patient should lie on his back with a strap around their neck; and let the practitioner stand at the head of the patient, while the patient sits on a chair.
E aprop fleubotoma la vena al lonc am fleubotomi ample petit a petit; e aprop extratz de sanc segon temprada quantitat o segon aquo que vezes de necessitat que es ad aquo; e aprop fay semblant del autra vena.	Then, bloodlet from the vein along the forearm with a wide lancet gradually; and extract blood in seasonable quantities or according to what you deem necessary for this; then do similarly with the other vein.

E las tuas venas que so fleubotomadas en le coyde so en las quals corr costuma en totz les homes, e la fleubotomia de lor es fayta segon dos manieyras, o pongen am le fleubotomi mirtilat o olivar a subtilitat declinant; o secsar am fleubotomi cutellar, e apelha si alnessil, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the two veins in the elbow which normally flow in all men are to be bloodlet in one of two ways, by using either myrtle or olive wood tubes (perhaps bent at an angle), or by using a lancet and handle; this latter is known as the 'alnessil', and it looks like this:

Forma de fleubotomi mirti:	Here is my translation of the provided text into English: 
sia le latz de lu ayssi cum vezes, e conveneys a obrir las venas concavas plenas procedentz apparentz grossas, e ad aquelas que conteno sanc gros torbat.	Have his sides thus and prepare to open those concave veins that are full and appear thick, and from which flows coarse blood.
E aquesta es la forma de fleubotomi olivar:	This is how one performs the olive oil phlebotomy:
E aquest fleubotomi es de menor latitut e de pus subtil extremitat, e conveneys a fleubotomia de venas subtils que conteno sanc subtil citri.	This phlebotomy has a smaller opening and a more delicate tip, which is suitable for the subtle veins that contain clear lemon-like blood.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena basilica la qual es una de tres venas: quar extratz le sanc de las malautias que so dejos le guolayro e·l col, e de aquo que siec le pietz e·l ventre.	Most importantly, draw blood from the patient's cubital fossa region, one of three areas: where it meets the arm and neck, then to their feet and abdomen.
E conveneys al fleubotomador, quan fleubotomia aquela, que guarde be aquela e sia sobre-temor en aquela, quar dejos lu ha arteria, e si erra e ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi, inscidira aquela arteria e accidira fluxs de sanc, per so que cove que no fleubotomes aquela am fleubotomi pungent, abantz sia sectant cum alnessil.	It is imperative that the phlebotomist exercise great caution when drawing blood from this area, for there lies an artery nearby; should they err in their incision, they may puncture it and cause a flow of blood, so it is best not to use sharp phlebotomy instruments, but rather cut with a scalpel.
E si no appar la basilica per apparicio manifesta, lahoras cove que tu laysses aquela e que tu mudes a la autre, o que cerques alcun ram sieu; o que fleubotomes en loc de lu finis del bras, quar aquela es manifesta; e secsa aquela am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit.	If the basilic vein does not appear visibly, you must move to another one or seek out a branch of it; if that is also not possible, draw blood from the end of their arm where this vein is most apparent. Remember to use a scalpel as previously mentioned.
Mays si tu voles la fleubotomia de lu meteyssa, lahoras cove denant la strictura del bras que toques le loc entro que conogues le loc dels pols, e aprop senha sobre lu am tencha; e aprop lia le bras e secsa la vena am seccio concava am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit; e guarda te que caja la percussio per alcu spazi del loc de la arteria.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E quan tu vezes, cum strenhes le liament, imflacio en le loc que has senhat am tencha, lahoras aquela inflacio es inflacio de la arteria, e donc squiva aquela.	And when you see that as the ligament is tightened, there is an inflation in the place you have marked with a cloth, then this inflation is of the artery and therefore avoid it.
E si vezes le sanc fluir en la fleubotomia ayssi cum aurina de enfant, e·l sanc es subtil rog, lahoras sapias que es del sanc de la arteria; e lahoras tu coyta e pausa le tieu dit sobre aquel per lonc spazi; e aprop osta le tieu dit, e si lo sanc es abscindit, quar motas veguadas es abscindit, lahoras tu strenh le bras e layssa aquel.	And if you see the blood flowing during flebotomy like the urine of a child, and the blood is very light colored, then know that it is arterial blood; in this case cover it with your finger for some time; then remove your finger, and if the blood appears cut off, as many times it does, then tighten the arm and leave it.
E guardes le malaute de la moccio de lu, e sia sobre-temor de lu e no maugua aquel per alcus dias entro que sia sanat.	Watch out for the patient's discharge, it is over their fear and does not hurt them for a few days until they are healed.
Mays si le sanc no es abscindit, e vezes que deves tu no es present medicina ad aquo, lahoras tu inscideys la arteria, si appar a tu; quar la extremitat de lu es contrayta, e es abscindit le sanc; o que prenguas scorsa de fistic, e fen aquela, e pren la una maytat e strenh aquela sobre le loc de la vena am strictura descent am liament e am pulvils entro al autra dia.	But if the blood is not cut off and you see that there is no medicine present for this, then you must cut into the artery, if it appears to you; because its end is contracted, and the blood is cut off; or take a fustic peel, and take half of it, tighten it over the vein's location with tight binding and with powders until another day.
E lahoras si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, lahoras cura aquel am aquo del qual es precedit a la rememoracio del loc de las polveras abscindentz flux de sanc.	And if the blood is cut off, so be it; but if not, then treat it with that which was described earlier for the place of the powders which stop the flow of blood.
E la abscizio del sanc de lu es dificil en motas disposicios per le loc petit de la plagua e la possibilitat del liament del bras.	And bloodletting from him is difficult in many positions due to the small location of the wound and the possibility of tying his arm.
Mays de la vena fusca la fleubotomia es juvament que extratz lo sanc de la partida subirana del cap e a la partida dejos del cors; per aquo quar es composta de ram de la basilica e de ram de cephalica, ayssi cum havem dit.	Compared to the lesser vein, phlebotomy is more beneficial for extracting blood from the upper part of the head and below the body; as it is composed of branches of the basilica and cephalic veins, as we have mentioned.
E cove al fleubotomant aquela que sia sobre-temor en la fleubotomia de lu, quar dejos aquela es un nervi; e adonc si ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi e atroba le nervi, accidira a lu stupor, e es difficil la sanacio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot, E aquest nervi motas veguadas apar al sentiment; e si es ocultat ad alcus homes e es subtil e no es monstrat, lahoras cove que tu pauses le fleubotomi am le qual tu fleubotomas am seccio de alnessil, e evita le nervi am la tua fortalesa.	And it is important for the phlebotomist to be aware of a nerve that lies close to the vein; if during the puncture of the phlebotomy they pierce this nerve, it will cause shock and difficulty in healing, and often it may not heal completely. This nerve appears near sensation; and if it is hidden from some people and is subtle, then use an almond-shaped lancet for your phlebotomy and avoid piercing the nerve with your strength.
E si la vena es entre dos nervis, lahoras tu fen la vena en la longitut.	And if the vein is between two nerves, then you should split the vein lengthwise.
Le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena cephalica es que atratz le sanc del cap e comfereys a las malautias dels huels.	The benefit of phlebotomy using the cephalic vein is that it draws blood from the head and helps with illnesses related to hypochondria.
E cove en aquest propriament, si vols que la fleubotomes pungen am fleubotomi olivar o am fleubotomi mirti; quar es la pus salva de totas las venas, quar no es dejos lu arteria ni nervi.	Here is the translation of the provided source sentence:

Here is the translation of your provided text: 
Mays empero fort leu es apostemat en alcus homes, quan no es fleubotomat en la primieyra percussio, mays no notz en re aquel apostema.
